questions.text: A 17-year-old girl presents to a clinic in India with her parents for a routine health checkup. During the visit, she confides in the Medical Officer that she is in a consensual sexual relationship with her 19-year-old boyfriend. Aware of the recent changes in the Indian legal system, the medical officer reflects on the age of consent laws to ensure appropriate medical and legal advice is provided. As per Criminal Law (Amendment) Act, 2013, what is the age at which a person can legally give consent for sexual activities as per this amendment?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) 18 years

 

Explanation:

 

The Criminal Law (Amendment) Act, 2013, significantly altered the landscape of sexual offence laws in India. One of the pivotal changes was the revision of the age of sexual consent to 18 years. This change was enacted to enhance the protection of minors from sexual exploitation and abuse. Under this amendment, any sexual activity with a person below 18 years of age is considered statutory rape, regardless of consent.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Statutory Rape: It is sexual intercourse with a girl below 18 years of age even with her consent. It is neither violent nor physically coerced.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 414

questions.text: During a practical session, medical students are learning about the detection of biological evidence in sexual assault cases. The senior resident presents various methods used to visualize evidence that is not easily visible to the naked eye. The students are asked to identify the technique that is most effective for making invisible or faint seminal stains visible.
questions.solution:
Ans. A) UV light

 

Option A:

 

Examination with Wood’s lamp (filtered UV light) may detect semen or foreign debris on the skin. When examined under filtered ultraviolet light, seminal stain shows a fluorescence of a bluish-white color (due to choline), which is not specific as other albuminous materials such as nasal, leucorrhoeal discharges and detergents also fluoresce. Fluorescence depends on choline of semen. It is masked by blood and disappears if the stain is soaked in water. Fresh stains have a characteristic odor.

 

Explanation:

 

Option B. Infrared: Infrared light is outside the visible spectrum, and its use is typically focused on different applications in forensic science, such as document examination or crime scene investigation. While it might be possible to use infrared to detect certain chemical components in semen, UV light is generally more effective for this purpose

 

Option C. Dark illumination:  This technique involves using light sources that emit in the UV or IR range but are not visible to the naked eye. It can help highlight stains or substances that might be difficult to see under normal lighting conditions. It is not as effective as UV light for detecting seminal stains.

 

Option D. Red light: Red light, like infrared light, is outside the visible range for human eyes. While it may have uses in certain forensic applications, it is not typically employed for detecting seminal stains.

 

Educational Objective:

 

UV light is an effective tool for visualizing invisible or faint seminal stains. Dried seminal stains on the skin appear as pale yellow glistening areas and will fluoresce under a Wood’s lamp. This technique is crucial in cases where the evidence is not readily apparent.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 434

choices.text: Dressing like the opposite sex
Using objects of the opposite sex for sexual gratification
Deriving pleasure from the suffering of another person
Engaging in sexual intercourse with a lower animal

questions.text: Define 'Fetichism' and identify its primary characteristic to enhance the diagnostic acumen.
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Using objects of the opposite sex for sexual gratification

 

Option B:

 

Fetichism is a type of sexual paraphilia where an individual derives sexual gratification from using objects associated with the opposite sex. These objects can be items of clothing, accessories, or other personal belongings. This behavior is characterized by a fixation on the object as a source of sexual pleasure.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Dressing like the opposite sex: This is characteristic of transvestic fetishism, where the individual derives sexual pleasure specifically from wearing clothing of the opposite sex.

 

Option C. Deriving pleasure from the suffering of another person: This behavior is indicative of sadism.

 

Option D. Engaging in sexual intercourse with a lower animal: This refers to bestiality/ zoophilia, a distinct paraphilia with animals, either vaginal, anal or oral. The usual victims being pets and farm animals.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Fetichism - Sexual gratification by contact with inanimate objects of opposite sex. Mostly seen in male.

 

Ref : Reddy 33/e. Pg 432

questions.text: In a forensic medicine class, the instructor demonstrates various physical examination techniques used in assessing individuals involved in unnatural sexual offenses. One such technique is the lateral buttock traction test. The students are asked to identify in which category of individuals this test is typically indicative.
questions.solution:
Ans. D) Habitual passive agent

 

Option D:

 

The lateral buttock traction test is performed to evaluate the laxity of the anal sphincter, which can be indicative of habitual passive anal intercourse. This test is particularly relevant in cases where an individual is suspected to be a habitual passive agent in unnatural sexual acts.

 

Findings in habitual passive agent - Perianal hair is shaved, Absorption of perianal fat with funnel shape depression of the anus, Perianal skin is thickened and keratinized, Dilatation of anus with loss of mucosal rugosity and prolapse of rectal mucosa

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Habitual active agent: This group might not show the same degree of anal sphincter laxity, as the test is more indicative of passive involvement. The only evidence commonly found in this group is the peculiar smell of anal glands transferred to the penis, and traces of faecal matter and lubricant on the organ.

 

Option B. Pedophilia active agent: Not related.

 

Option C. Bestiality active agent: This test is not specific to bestiality but focuses on the physical changes associated with passive anal intercourse.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Lateral buttock traction test is the paradoxical dilatation of anus during bimanual traction of buttocks, indicative of habitual passive anal intercourse.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 429

questions.text: In a forensic toxicology laboratory, a forensic expert is demonstrating the examination of biological evidence to a group of trainees. The focus is on the analysis of semen stains, a crucial aspect of evidence in sexual assault cases. The expert explains the process of examining semen under filtered ultraviolet light and asks the trainees to identify the substance responsible for the bluish-white coloration observed in semen when it is exposed to such light.
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Choline

 

Option C:

 

When semen is examined under filtered ultraviolet light, it exhibits a bluish-white fluorescence. This characteristic fluorescence is primarily due to the presence of choline, a component found in semen. The identification of this fluorescence is an important aspect of forensic analysis in cases involving sexual offenses.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Proteins: While proteins are a significant component of semen, they are not primarily responsible for the bluish-white fluorescence under UV light.

 

Option B. DNA: DNA does contribute to the overall composition of semen, but it does not cause the semen to fluoresce under UV light.

 

Option D. Lipids: Lipids are present in semen, but they do not contribute to the bluish-white fluorescence observed under UV light.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Seminal fluid examination (Physical examination) - dry seminal stains are grayish white in color and under UV light show bluish-white fluorescence due to presence of choline.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 434

choices.text: Written Consent of the accused is compulsory, but of the victim is not required
Written Consent of the victim is compulsory, but of the accused is not required
Written Consent of victim is compulsory but not mandatory for accused
Since the police have brought the accused and victim, consent is implied

questions.text: During a forensic medicine rotation, medical students are engaged in a session about the legal and ethical aspects of examining sexual assault cases. The forensic faculty, emphasizes the importance of consent in these examinations. To assess their understanding, the students are presented with a scenario where both the accused and the victim are brought in for examination, and they are asked to determine the correct protocol regarding consent.
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Written Consent of victim is compulsory but not mandatory for accused   

 

Option C:

  • In cases of sexual assault, the examination of the victim requires written consent to ensure that their rights are protected and to provide them with control over their medical and legal interactions. This consent is critical to uphold the ethical standards of care and respect for the victim's autonomy and privacy.
  • The accused's examination, on the other hand, is not mandatory, but should be tried; and if the accused refuses then can be done forcefully, especially if it is performed under a legal mandate or court order where the accused's compliance may be compelled.

 

S. 164 A Cr.P.C (Examination of Victim) (Now, S.184 BNSS - Bhartiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita): When during investigation, medical examination of victim of rape/attempted rape, shall be conducted by a RMP in government hospital or a local authority and in the absence of such a practitioner, by any other RMP, with the consent of such woman or of a person competent to give such consent on her behalf and such woman should be sent to a RMP within 24 hours from the time of receiving the information relating to the commission of such offence. The report shall specifically record that the consent of the woman or of competent person on her behalf to such examination had been obtained. Nothing in this section shall be lawful if examination is done without consent of the woman.

 

S. 53 (1) CrPC (Examination of Accused) (Now S.52 BNSS - Bhartiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita):  Request for examination should be made by SI (Sub Inspector) and above. If the person is arrested then examination can be conducted without consent.

 

Consent is a crucial aspect that must be explicitly obtained and documented, regardless of the circumstances under which the individuals are brought in for examination.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. & B. Both of these options are incorrect as they suggest that consent is only required from one party, which contradicts the standard ethical and legal procedures.

 

Option D. Implied consent is not adequate in the context of a forensic examination, especially in sensitive cases like sexual assault, but the implied consent is for accused, if arrested by Police.

 

Educational Objective:

 

  • Examination of Victim: (S. 184 BNSS) Consent of woman for examination is must and should be examined under the supervision of female RMP.
  • Examination of Accused: (S. 52 BNSS). Request for examination should be made by SI (Sub Inspector) and above. If the person is arrested, then examination can be conducted without consent. This ensures ethical compliance and legal validity of the examination process.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 413-414

choices.text: Notches are present posteriorly
Notches extend to the vaginal wall
Notches are covered by mucous membrane

questions.text: A forensic examiner is reviewing a case involving allegations of sexual assault against a 17-year-old girl. During the medicolegal examination, the examiner evaluates the hymen for signs of trauma or injury. While examining the hymenal features, the examiner notes specific characteristics that need to be correctly identified to differentiate between normal anatomical variations and potential signs of trauma. Which of the following features is indicative of a normal fimbriated hymen and not a ruptured hymen, which could be crucial in the context of this sexual assault case?
questions.solution:
Ans. D) Notches are covered by mucous membrane

 

Option D:

 

In the context of a forensic examination, distinguishing a fimbriated hymen from a ruptured hymen is crucial.

 

Fimbriated hymen: The margin of the hymen is sometimes fimbriated (wavy or undulating or markedly irregular) and shows multiple notches which may be mistaken for artificial tears. Natural notches are usually symmetrical, occur anteriorly, do not extend to the vaginal wall and are covered with mucous membrane. Tears caused by sexual intercourse or by foreign body are usually situated posteriorly at one or both sides, or in the midline, and usually extend to the vaginal wall and are not covered with mucous membrane.

 

This detail is particularly significant in cases of alleged sexual assault.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Notches present posteriorly: This can be observed in both normal and ruptured hymens and does not conclusively indicate trauma.

 

Option B. Notches are asymmetrical: Asymmetry in hymenal notches can be a normal variant and is not exclusively indicative of rupture.

 

Option C. Notches extend to the vaginal wall: While this might suggest trauma, it is not a definitive feature distinguishing a fimbriated hymen from a ruptured one.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Fimbriated Hymen: Having multiple notches which may be mistaken for tears caused by sexual intercourse.

 

Differentiating points by which natural notches can be differentiated from artificial tears. Natural notches are usually symmetrical, occurs anteriorly, do not extend to vaginal wall, and are covered with mucous membrane.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 390

choices.text: Sexual assault female examination kit
Sexual assessment forensic examination kit
Sexual assessment Forensic evidence kit
Sexual assault forensic evidence kit

questions.text: A 25-year-old female is brought to a forensic clinic following a reported sexual assault. The nurse is preparing to collect evidence as part of a sexual assault examination. As the nurse assembles the necessary equipment, what does the acronym 'SAFE kit' stand for in this context?
questions.solution:
Ans. D) Sexual assault forensic evidence kit

 

Explanation:

 

In the context of forensic medicine and sexual assault examinations, the acronym 'SAFE kit' stands for a Sexual Assault Forensic Evidence kit. This kit is used to collect physical and forensic evidence in cases of sexual assault, to establish a uniform method of examination and evidence collection

 

It is also called sexual assault evidence collection (SAEC) kit, or physical evidence recovery kit (PERK). The kit was developed by Louis Vitullo and was referred to as the Vitullo kit. The MOHFW guidelines strongly advocate the use of SAFE kit for collecting and preserving physical evidence.

 

Content of SAFE Kit

 

 

Educational Objective:

 

'SAFE kit' - Sexual Assault Forensic Evidence kit, a Model Kit for Comprehensive Care and Documentation of Evidence in cases of Sexual Assault, to establish a uniform method of examination and evidence collection

 

Ref: GUIDELINES & PROTOCOLS, Medico-legal care for survivors/victims of Sexual Violence, MOHFW, GoI

questions.text: A forensic expert is conducting an examination in a case involving potential sexual activity and hymenal rupture. In the context of findings related to sexual acts, what is the most common location of hymenal rupture during sexual intercourse?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) 5-7 o'clock position

 

Explanation:

 

Tears on hymen caused by sexual intercourse or by foreign body is situated postero-laterally, i.e. 5 or 7 o'clock position. In cases of sexual assault on female child, the hymen often escapes injury because it is deeply seated.

 

Some Important Pointers

 

  • Medicolegal Aspects : The presence of unruptured hymen is a presumption, but is not an absolute proof of virginity.
  • The semilunar hymen often ruptures on both sides. The annular hymen which nearly closes the vaginal orifice may suffer several tears.
  • Soon after the act, the torn margins are sharp, red and bleed on touch. Even when examined after 3–4 days of offence, the edges are swollen, congested and smaller.
  • Signs of recent rupture of hymen are ragged tears in the hymen with lack of epithelial healing, edema and hemorrhage.
  • The status of hymen is irrelevant because it can be torn due to cycling, riding or masturbation. An intact hymen does not rule out sexual violence, and a torn hymen does not prove previous sexual intercourse.

 

 

Educational Objective:

 

In cases involving sexual activity and hymenal rupture, the most common location of hymenal rupture during sexual intercourse is typically in the 5-7 o'clock (Posterio-lateral) position. This information is significant in forensic examinations and assessments of sexual activity.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 390

questions.text: A forensic resident is assessing a victim who may have been subjected to physical assault. To aid in the detection of certain types of injuries that might not be visible to the naked eye, the resident decides to use toluidine blue contrast. What is toluidine blue contrast primarily used to detect in such forensic examinations?
questions.solution:
Ans. A) Fresh micro-injuries

 

Option A:

 

Toluidine blue dye is specifically used for highlighting fresh micro-injuries, making it an effective tool in forensic examinations of recent sexual assault cases.

 

In case injuries are not visible, suspected injuries are looked for using a magnifying glass/colposcope (whatever is available). If 1% toluidine blue is sprayed and excess is wiped out. Subtle injuries will stand out in blue. Care should be taken that this test is done only after swabs for trace evidence has been collected.

 

Local Examination of evidence of Rape

 

 

Explanation:

 

Option B. Remote micro-injuries are not typically highlighted by toluidine blue dye.

 

Option C. Seminal stains are detected using different forensic techniques, like the acid phosphatase test.

 

Option D. Salivary stains are identified through other methods, such as DNA analysis.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Toluidine blue dye is used in detecting the fresh micro-injuries in sexual assault cases, over anogenital area.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 420-421

questions.text: In a sexual assault case, a forensic expert needs to determine the approximate time frame of the assault. The expert decides to use Lugol's iodine test to detect vaginal cells. What is the maximum duration after an assault that this test can yield positive results?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) 4 days

 

Explanation:

 

Lugol's iodine test can detect vaginal cells for up to 4 days post-assault, aiding in establishing the timeline of the incident in forensic investigations.

 

Lugol’s iodine test: It is now redundant. Iodine solution painted on the glans would reveal the presence vaginal epithelial cells by turning brown due to the glycogen present in them.

 

This is done by cleaning the organ with a filter-paper and exposing the paper to vapours of Lugol's iodine. The paper becomes brown if vaginal epithelial cells are present, because of the glycogen. The test is positive up to fourth day.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Understanding the time frame and application of Lugol's iodine test in forensic gynecological examinations. Glycogen-rich squamous epithelial cells of the vaginal tract may be stained with Lugol’s iodine.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 426

questions.text: An old garment found at a crime scene is suspected to have seminal stains. The forensic team needs to determine the appropriate test to confirm the presence of seminal fluid. Which test is best suited for detecting old seminal stains?
questions.solution:
Ans. D) Creatine phosphokinase test

 

Option D:

 

Creatine phosphokinase test: Spermatozoa contain a high concentration of creatine phosphokinase, which is more than double than that found in any other body fluid.  Normal seminal fluid contains 385 to 1400 units of CPK/ml. Levels over 400 are almost diagnostic of seminal stains. The enzyme is stable and can be demonstrated even in old stains of six months. The test will be negative in case of aspermia.

 

Note - In the absence of spermatozoa, a stain which gives characteristic fluorescence in ultraviolet light, positive precipitin test, high level of acid phosphatase and a high creatine phosphokinase, p30 (prostate specific antigen) can be considered to be due to semen.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. The Acid phosphatase test (walker test) this test is useful in the absence of sperm. The value >100 Bodansky unit indicate that the ejaculation occurred within 12 hours of examination. Level decreases with time and there is little chance of identifying it after 48 h.

 

Option B. Barbario test - due to presence of spermine (from prostate) in seminal fluid, yellow needle shaped rhombic crystals of spermine picrate are formed when treated with picric acid. This test is positive without the presence of spermatozoa.

 

Option C. Florence test is used for identifying semen, but it is more effective on fresher stains. This is due to presence of choline (from seminal vesicle) in seminal fluid, dark brown rhombic crystals of choline iodide appear when treated with Florence reagent.

 

Educational Objective:

 

The Creatine phosphokinase test is effective in detecting old seminal stains, making it suitable for analyzing evidence in cases where the stains are even six months old.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 435-436

questions.text: A 32-year-old male is brought to the police station after several reports from a residential area about a man peering into windows at night. Witnesses have provided consistent descriptions and reported feeling violated by the intrusions. The suspect does not attempt interaction or contact with the individuals; instead, he is reported to be seeking secretive visual encounters. The behavior has escalated over several months, causing distress among the residents. The suspect, upon interrogation, admits to finding sexual gratification in watching others without their knowledge or consent. According to the descriptions of his actions, which term best categorizes his behavior?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Voyeurism

 

Option C:

 

Voyeurism/Scoptophilia - There is a morbid desire of the individual to observe unsuspecting people undress or naked, taking bath, see the genitalia or watch intercourse to get erotic excitement and sexual gratification. It is commonly seen in males.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Exhibitionism: Exhibitionism involves exposing one's genitals to others, typically in public places, for sexual arousal. It is not synonymous with secretly observing others.

 

Option B. Stalking: Stalking refers to the persistent and unwanted pursuit of someone, involving behaviors such as following, monitoring, or unwanted communication. While invasive, it is distinct from voyeurism.

 

Option D. Harassment: Harassment encompasses a broader range of unwanted behaviors, including verbal or physical actions that cause distress, but it may not specifically involve secret observation.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Voyeurism is the act of secretly observing others in private situations without their knowledge or consent, driven by the voyeur's desire for sexual pleasure.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 413, 433

choices.text: Recent anal sex with child
Repeated anal sex with child
First anal sex with child

questions.text: A Police officer brings a 15-year-old male child to the doctor for medical examination. The mother of the child gives the history that his uncle has been threatening and sexually assaulting him for the past 2 years, which she came to know now and complained to the police. After doing the complete examination, the doctor examines the anus, which shows features in the picture below. This is suggestive of?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Repeated anal sex with child

 

Option B:

 

In the image above, there is loss of normal anal folds. The perianal skin is thickened and smooth / due to constant friction. These all suggests repeated anal sex with child.

 

Sodomy

 

It is the anal intercourse between two males (homosexual sodomy) or between a male and a female (heterosexual sodomy). It is also called buggery. Features of habitual passive agent in sodomy –

 

  • Loss of normal folds around anus
  • Skin around anus thickened & smooth. Shiny silvery hyper keratinized skin may   also be present.
  • Lateral traction test positive
  • Pain and tenderness absent during examination of anus.
  • There may be shaving of anal hair.
  • Anal sphincter is lax, opening is patulous, canal is dilated and there may be loss of fine symmetric rugal pattern, along with congested or dilated veins.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Recent anal sex with child: Incorrect, as the presence of penile secretion (semen) is the main indicators for recent anal sex. These are not present in the image provided.

 

Option C. First anal sex with child: Incorrect, because in non- habitual victim, injuries like abrasions, bruises and lacerations are present at anal opening but in the image these are absent.

 

Option D. Normal anus: Is not the answer because normal anus looks like as below

 

 

Educational Objective:

 

Sodomy is the anal intercourse between two males (homosexual sodomy) or between a male and a female (heterosexual sodomy).

 

It is called gerontophilia when the passive agent is an adult, and paederasty, when the passive agent is a child, who is known as catamite. A pedophile is an adult who repeatedly engages in sexual activities with children.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 427

questions.text: A forensic expert is reviewing a case where an adult individual was found deceased in a private residence with evidence suggesting an atypical context at the scene. The individual was discovered partially clothed with materials that constricted the neck and pornographic content in close proximity. There were no signs of forced entry or struggle, and the preliminary investigation indicated that the individual was alone at the time of death. The expert is tasked with determining the most likely behavior associated with the circumstances of death, given that there is a possibility of a sexual element to the asphyxiation. Which of the following behaviors is most commonly linked to the findings of sexual asphyxia in this context?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Masochism

 

Option C:

 

Masochism/Passive Algolagnia is sexual gratification obtained only when they receive painful stimuli from the opposite partner. It is the reverse of sadism. More commonly seen in males.

 

Sexual asphyxia, also referred to as autoerotic asphyxia, is a form of masochism. It involves deliberately reducing oxygen to the brain during sexual stimulation to enhance the sexual experience. The presence of self-applied neck compression devices, along with the secluded and prepared environment, are often characteristic of this practice. It is a dangerous activity that can lead to accidental death due to asphyxiation.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Voyeurism - Voyeurism is the act of obtaining sexual pleasure from observing others undress or engage in sexual activities, which is not directly related to the scenario described.

 

Option B. Frotteurism is characterized by a person obtaining sexual pleasure from touching or rubbing against a non-consenting person, typically in crowded places.

 

Option D. Tribadism/Lesbianism, generally refers to the act of genital-to-genital contact, usually between two women, and is not related to asphyxiative practices.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Sexual Asphyxia (Autoerotic asphyxia/ Hypoxyphilia / Asphyxiophilia)

 

  1. Deliberate neck compression during masturbation.
  2. Scene of crime is diagnostic:
    • Person is naked
    • Pornographic material nearby.
  3. Manner of death: Accidental.
  4. Associated with Masochism and Transvestism

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 375

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman presents to the emergency department accompanied by law enforcement for a forensic examination after reporting a sexual assault. The medical officer, trained in conducting sexual assault forensic examinations, prepares to assess for any injuries consistent with the patient's report. Part of the examination involves assessing the genital area for any trauma, including potential hymenal tears. The medical officer selects the appropriate instrument to aid in documenting any findings that may be present in the hymenal ring. Which instrument is traditionally used to facilitate the examination of the hymen and document any tears that may be indicative of forced penetration?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Glaister-Keene rod

 

Option B:

 

The Glaister-Keene rod is an instrument used specifically in forensic medicine to document hymenal tears. It is a smooth, rounded rod that can gently be passed through the hymenal ring, allowing for clear visualization and documentation of the hymen's condition during a forensic examination. This tool is particularly useful in cases where the integrity of the hymen is in question, such as after a reported sexual assault.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Vaginal speculum is used in gynecological examinations to visualize the cervix and vagina, but it is not specifically designed for the detailed documentation of hymenal tears.

 

Option C. Cylinder rod is not a recognized tool for forensic documentation of hymenal tears.

 

Option D. Hegar’s rod is used to dilate the cervix in gynecological procedures, not specifically for forensic examination of hymenal tears.

 

Educational Objective:

 

The Glaister-Keene rod is the instrument used in forensic examinations to document hymenal tears in a victim of rape

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 419

choices.text: Internal iliac artery ligation, blood transfusion, inform police, medico-legal report
Blood transfusion, internal iliac artery ligation, inform police, medico-legal report
Blood transfusion, medico-legal report, internal iliac artery ligation, inform police
Inform police, medico-legal report, blood transfusion, internal iliac artery ligation

questions.text: A 12-year-old girl, suspected of having been sexually abused, is brought to a tertiary care hospital's emergency department by her parents, who report she has been bleeding from the genital area and complaining of pelvic pain. On examination, the emergency physician suspects a pelvic fracture and notes active genital bleeding. The patient is hemodynamically unstable. The medical officer is faced with multiple urgent tasks that need to be prioritized appropriately to manage the patient effectively while also fulfilling legal obligations. Considering the need for immediate life-saving interventions alongside the medicolegal requirements of such a case, what should be the appropriate sequence of management?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Blood transfusion, internal iliac artery ligation, inform police, medico-legal report

 

Explanation:
 

The immediate medical stabilization of the patient is the primary concern. This starts with a blood transfusion to address hypovolemia and potential hemorrhagic shock. Following resuscitation, the next step is surgical intervention to control active bleeding, which may include internal iliac artery ligation if indicated. After the patient is medically stabilized, the focus shifts to the legal obligations, which involve informing the police and preparing a medico-legal report. This report should detail the findings of the medical examination and the treatment provided, which is crucial for any subsequent legal proceedings.

 

Educational Objective:
 

The prioritization of medical interventions in the emergency management of a patient who presents with life-threatening conditions secondary to sexual abuse. It is essential to stabilize the patient's medical condition before addressing legal requirements.

 

Ref: Review of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology, Gautam Biswas, 3/e. Pg 370-371

questions.text: A 20-year-old woman presents to the emergency department of a district hospital for an examination following a report of sexual assault. As part of the forensic examination, the medical officer prepares a wet mount of the vaginal secretions to assess for the presence of spermatozoa. The findings of motile spermatozoa in the vaginal secretions will be crucial in providing information about the timing of the alleged assault. Understanding the typical viability of spermatozoa after ejaculation during intercourse is critical for interpreting the findings. How long after intercourse can motile spermatozoa typically be found in vaginal secretions?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) 12 hours

 

Explanation:

 

In living persons, motile sperms are usually seen up to six hours and rarely 12 hours after ejaculation into the vagina. Complete sperms are seen up to twenty-six hours, and occasionally up to two to three days. Then they separate into heads and tails.

 

When semen is kept at room temperature, full motility persists for about three hours; fifty percent are motile by eight hours, and ten percent for 24 hours. If the specimen is kept at body temperature, motility persists for several hours.

 

Educational Objective:

 

The presence of motile spermatozoa in vaginal secretions is most commonly indicative of sexual intercourse occurring within the past 12 hours.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 436

choices.text: Too tough to rupture

questions.text: A forensic expert is reviewing a case involving a young child brought by concerned guardians. The child exhibited distress and mild physical symptoms suggesting possible sexual abuse. During the examination, he noted the absence of hymenal rupture, which raised questions about the assessment's findings among the para clinical staff. The forensic expert, called upon to provide clarity, emphasized a key anatomical feature of the hymen in prepubertal children that might explain the lack of expected trauma signs. What is the primary reason the hymen in children might not show rupture in suspected cases of sexual assault?
questions.solution:
Ans. A) Deep seated

 

Explanation:

 

The hymen in prepubertal children is often deep seated, meaning it is positioned deeper within the vaginal vestibule compared to that in adolescents and adults. This anatomical positioning can provide a degree of protection against trauma, potentially explaining the absence of hymenal rupture even in the context of suspected sexual assault.

 

Educational Objective:

 

In a young child, there are few or no signs of general violence, for the child usually has no idea of what is happening and also incapable of resisting. As the hymen is deeply situated and the vagina is less capacious, it is impossible for penetration of the penis to take place.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 421

choices.text: Any passive victim of sodomy
Young passive victim of sodomy
Elderly passive victim of sodomy
Female passive victim of sodomy

questions.text: In a forensic medicine lecture focusing on the terminology used in the context of sexual offenses, the term "catamite" is discussed. The lecturer explains that this term has historical roots and is used to describe a specific type of victim in cases of sodomy. Understanding the precise definition of such terms is crucial for forensic experts, especially when interpreting legal and historical texts. Based on this, how is the term "catamite" best defined?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Young passive victim of sodomy

 

Explanation:

 

A "catamite" traditionally refers to a young boy who is the passive partner in sodomy. The term has historical and pejorative connotations and is derived from classical antiquity, where it was used to describe young boys involved in such relationships, often within the context of a pederastic relationship in ancient Greece and Rome.

 

Educational Objective:

 

  • Catamite - Refers to a young male passive victim of sodomy
  • Paederast/ Pedophile - Refers to an adult man who repeatedly engages in sexual activities with children
  • Infantophilia is a subcategory of pedophilia in which the victims are < 5 years.
  • Ephebophilia, also known as hebephilia, is the sexual attraction of an adult to pubescent or post-pubescent adolescents.
  • Gerontophilia refers to the sexual preference for the elderly.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 427

questions.text: In a forensic medicine workshop focusing on the analysis of physical findings in cases of sexual assault, the discussion turns to specific injury patterns that can provide crucial evidence. One pattern, known as the "Tyre sign," is highlighted for its diagnostic significance. The participants are asked to identify the context in which this particular injury pattern is most commonly observed. Based on your knowledge of forensic medicine, where is the "Tyre sign" typically seen?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Anal abuse

 

Option B:

 

Non-habitual Passive Victim - Hematoma may be present which is diffuse and present circumferentially around anal margin with obliteration of normal anal skin folds giving an appearance of a tyre (‘tyre sign’) or appears as localized swelling. The anus opening appears blue and there may be some edema around the anus which may last up to 2 days after the assault—this may be mistaken for hemorrhoids.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Bite marks have their own distinctive patterns and do not present as "Tyre signs."

 

Option C. Buccal coitus may result in injuries or trauma to the oral cavity but does not produce the "Tyre sign."

 

Option D. While vulvovaginal abuse can result in various forms of injury, the "Tyre sign" specifically refers to the patterned injury associated with anal abuse.

 

Educational Objective:

 

The "Tyre sign" refers to a pattern of injury that resembles the tread marks of a tyre and is typically associated with anal abuse. This sign indicates the application of significant pressure and friction around the anal area, leading to a patterned injury that can be diagnostic of the type of abuse sustained.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 427

questions.text: During a forensic psychiatry seminar, the topic of paraphilias is discussed extensively. The presenter emphasizes the importance of distinguishing between paraphilias and sexual orientations or preferences. Based on this understanding, which of the following is not considered a paraphilia?
questions.solution:
Ans. A) Lesbianism

 

Option A:

 

Lesbianism, defined as sexual and romantic attraction between women, is a sexual orientation, not a paraphilia. It involves consensual relationships and does not encompass the atypical or socially unacceptable behaviors characteristic of paraphilias.

 

Tribadism/ Lesbianism is not an offence in India

 

Explanation:

 

Option B. Fetishism is a paraphilia that involves sexual arousal from a non-living object or a specific body part that is not typically associated with sexual arousal.

 

Option C. Frotteurism is a paraphilia characterized by deriving sexual pleasure from touching or rubbing against a non-consenting person, often in crowded places.

 

Option D. Voyeurism is a paraphilia involving sexual arousal from watching unsuspecting individuals who are naked, disrobing, or engaging in sexual activity.

 

Educational Objective:

 

The most common paraphilias as described in Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-V) are:

 

  1. Sexual Sadism
  2. Sexual Masochism
  3. Transvestic fetishism
  4. Voyeurism
  5. Exhibitionism
  6. Fetishism
  7. Frotteurism
  8. Pedophilia

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 430-431

questions.text: During a medicolegal consultation, a forensic expert is reviewing a case involving a middle-aged male detainee who exhibited uncontrollable sexual behavior while in custody. The detainee's medical history is notable for psychiatric evaluations that documented a longstanding pattern of compulsive sexual thoughts and behaviors. The forensic expert is tasked with providing an opinion on the detainee's condition to assist in understanding his behavior from a medicolegal perspective. In forensic medicine, what term is used to describe a condition characterized by an overwhelming sexual desire in males, which might be relevant to this case?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Satyriasis

 

Option C:

 

Satyriasis is the term used to describe a condition in males characterized by an excessive or pathological sexual desire. This term may be relevant in legal and forensic discussions where understanding the nature of an individual's sexual behavior is pertinent to the case at hand, such as assessing the detainee's behavior in this scenario.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Nymphomania is the female counterpart of satyriasis, characterized by excessive sexual desire in females.

 

Option B. Tribadism/ Lesbianism, defined as sexual and romantic attraction between women, is a sexual orientation.

 

Option D. Sadism involves deriving pleasure from inflicting pain or humiliation, which is distinct from excessive sexual desire.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Satyriasis: Morbid, insatiable sexual need or desire in a man.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 384

questions.text: A forensic expert is reviewing a case involving allegations of non-consensual sexual activity. The case file describes an incident where the assailant forced the victim to engage in oral-genital contact, specifically involving the victim's mouth and the assailant's penis. This activity is documented in the forensic report, and the expert is tasked with categorizing the act based on its specific nature to assist in the legal proceedings. In the context of forensic sexual offense terminology, how is penile-buccal coitus best described?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Fellatio

 

Option C:


Fellatio is the term used to describe oral-genital contact where the mouth is used to stimulate the penis. In the context of this case, where the report describes forced oral-genital contact involving the assailant's penis and the victim's mouth, the term fellatio accurately categorizes the act described.

 

Diagnosis - by finding the semen in the respiratory tract or stomach of the victim. Spermatozoa can be found in the mouth up to nine hours provided: (1) the victim has not cleaned the teeth nor taken a hot drink after the incident, and (2) careful swabbing has been done by rubbing around inside mouth, under tongue and gum margins. The victim's mouth is rinsed with distilled water, which can be expectorated into a sterile container, centrifuged and examined.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Sadism involves deriving pleasure from inflicting pain or humiliation on others, which does not specifically describe the act of oral-genital contact.

 

Option B. Fetishism is characterized by sexual arousal from objects or specific body parts, not necessarily involving oral-genital contact.

 

Option D. Cunnilingus refers to oral stimulation of the female genitalia, which is not the act described in the case file.

 

Educational Objective:
 

Fellatio means oral stimulation of the penis either by the female or male.

 

Cunnilingus means oral stimulation of female genitalia.

 

Medico-legal Aspects - In India, under the Hindu Marriage Act, insistence on buccal coitus, if it is non-consensual and repetitive, constitutes a valid ground for divorce.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 429-430

questions.text: During a forensic medicine conference, a Junior resident presents a case involving a peculiar and disturbing homicide. The victim was found deceased with evidence suggesting that the perpetrator engaged in sexual acts with the corpse post-mortem. This case was particularly challenging due to the intertwining of violent and sexual elements, prompting an in-depth discussion on the classification of such crimes within forensic medicine. He elaborated on the psychological motivations behind the crime, suggesting it fell into a category characterized by deriving sexual pleasure from the act of killing. This extreme form of behavior, often referred to in forensic circles, is classified as what?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Algolagnia

 

Option B:

 

Lust murder is often associated with algolagnia, a condition where sexual gratification is derived from pain, either inflicted or endured. However, lust murder represents an extreme manifestation where the infliction of pain escalates to the act of killing. The case presented highlights the need for forensic experts to understand these psychological motivations to accurately categorize the crime and assist in criminal profiling.

 

The mutilation of the victim may include evisceration and/or displacement of the genitalia. After murder, the sadist may have sexual intercourse with her (necrophilia). He may tear out the genitalia or other organs, may suck or lick the wounds or eat the flesh of his victim to derive sexual pleasure (necrophagia/anthropophagy). It is the consequence of extreme sadist practice.

 

A lust murder begins with the obsessive compulsions of the offender. Generally, they have a sexual obsession with their victims, and organized lust murderers may stalk their victims for months or weeks before the actual killing.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Troilism involves sexual arousal from watching one's partner engage in sexual activities with a third party, which does not relate to the violent nature of lust murder.

 

Option C. Masochism is characterized by obtaining pleasure from one's own pain or humiliation, not from inflicting pain or death on others.

 

Option D. Frotteurism involves deriving sexual pleasure from rubbing against a non-consenting person, typically in crowded places, without the lethal component present in lust murder.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Lust Murder - It is a homicide in which the offender stabs, pierces, slashes or otherwise mutilates the sexual organs or areas of the victim’s body. With torturing the partner, sexual arousal starts, and with death of the partner, full gratification is obtained.

 

The signature component of the crime that which names it a ‘lust murder’ is the killer acting out their fantasies with their victims and the bodies of those victims.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 431

questions.text: In a case review session, a forensic expert discusses a case involving an individual who deliberately seeks out situations that result in self-inflicted pain for sexual gratification. This behavior has led to multiple emergency room visits for injuries that the individual was reluctant to explain. During these sessions, the expert emphasizes the importance of recognizing specific psychological patterns that may underlie such behaviors, especially when they might have legal implications or require specialized intervention. What term best describes this condition where an individual derives sexual pleasure from experiencing pain to oneself?
questions.solution:
Ans. D) Masochism

 

Option D:

 

Masochism is a condition where an individual derives sexual pleasure from experiencing pain or humiliation. Understanding masochism is crucial for identifying individuals who may be at risk of self-harm or engaging in dangerous behaviors, as well as for providing appropriate psychological support and intervention.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Transvestism involves dressing in the clothes of the opposite sex, mainly for reasons unrelated to experiencing pain.

 

Option B. Fetishism is a sexual fixation on a nonliving object or nongenital body part, which does not inherently involve pain.

 

Option C. Sadism involves deriving pleasure from inflicting pain on others, which is the opposite of masochism.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Masochism/Passive Algolagnia is sexual gratification is obtained only when they receive painful stimulus from opposite partner. It is the reverse of sadism. More commonly seen in males.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 431

choices.text: Sexual pleasure is obtained by witnessing the act of urination
Sexual gratification by rubbing private parts against non-consenting individuals
Sexual practice involving three people
Sexual pleasure in watching females getting undressed

questions.text: In a recent case at a district hospital, a medical officer is presented with a challenging situation involving a 25-year-old male detainee brought in by police for a medicolegal examination. The detainee was apprehended at a local shopping mall after several complaints from shoppers about his inappropriate conduct. The medical officer, evaluates the detainee's behavior, is indicative of Frotteurism, a paraphilic disorder. Frotteurism is characterized by?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Sexual gratification by rubbing private parts against non-consenting individuals

 

Option B:

 

Frotteurism is a paraphilic disorder characterized by a strong desire or act of touching or rubbing one's genitals against another person, typically in a crowded public space, without their consent and to achieve sexual gratification. The described scenario where the individual targets unsuspecting commuters for sexual pleasure through physical contact is indicative of frotteurism.

 

Explanation:


Option A. Gaining sexual pleasure from witnessing acts of urination is known as urophilia.
 

Option C. A sexual practice involving three people refers to a threesome, which is a consensual sexual activity among three individuals, not related to non-consensual touching or rubbing.
 

Option D. Voyeurism is the act of obtaining sexual pleasure from watching others, typically strangers, undressing or engaging in sexual activity, without their knowledge or consent.

 

Educational Objective:


Frotteurism is a paraphilic disorder characterized by obtaining sexual gratification from rubbing or touching non-consenting individuals, often in crowded public settings.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 433

questions.text: A forensic expert is summoned upon to deliver expert testimony in a notable legal case involving a 35-year-old male defendant accused of engaging in onanism in a setting that has raised public and legal concerns. The court is seeking clarity on accused behavior viewed from a forensic and medicolegal standpoint, considering the act's context and its implications for public decency and legal boundaries. How should the forensic expert classify the act of onanism in this scenario, given the complexities of legal and social standards?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Perversion

 

Option C:

 

Onanism, traditionally associated with masturbation, is considered a perversion in the context of historical and some contemporary perspectives. However, it's important to note that modern psychiatry and clinical psychology do not typically classify masturbation itself as a disorder or perversion unless it is compulsive, interferes with normal daily functioning, or involves non-consenting individuals. The legal implications, such as charges of indecent assault, would depend more on the public nature of the act or the non-consensual distribution of recorded material rather than the act of masturbation itself.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. A natural sexual offense would imply an act that is inherently wrong by natural standards, which does not accurately describe masturbation.

 

Option B. An unnatural sexual offense typically refers to sexual acts that deviate from societal norms to an extreme extent, often involving non-consenting parties, which is not applicable to private masturbation.

 

Option D. Indecent assault generally involves non-consensual contact with another individual, which is not the case with private acts of masturbation but could apply to the public behavior or distribution of content without consent.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Masturbation/Onanism - Deliberate self-stimulation which results in sexual arousal. It is an offence when practiced openly, e.g. in telephone booths, bus or toilets.

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 432

questions.text: During an investigation of a case involving sexual abuse of a minor, a forensic expert is consulted to provide testimony. The case involves an adult male and a minor male, with the minor being the passive participant in anal intercourse. The expert is asked to define the term that historically describes this specific type of sexual relationship.
questions.solution:
Ans. D) Pederasty

 

Option D:

 

Pederasty refers to anal intercourse where the passive agent is a child. This term historically and legally denotes a relationship between an adult male and a male child, often in the context of sexual abuse.

 

Explanation:

 

Option A. Catamite: Refers to a young boy in such a relationship, not the act itself.

 

Option B. Pedophile: Describes an adult with a sexual preference for prepubescent children, regardless of the nature of the act.

 

Option C. Gerontophilia: Involves sexual preference for elderly individuals, unrelated to the scenario.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Pederasty is intimate sexual relations, especially anal intercourse with a boy outside his immediate family as the passive partner (the boy is known as catamite, and the man as pederast).

 

Ref: Reddy 33/e. Pg 427
